thread.title_full: Manchester United must keep Michael Carrick - Paul Scholes | Daily Mail Online

author: Daniel Matthews For Mailonline
title: Manchester United must keep Michael Carrick - Paul Scholes | Daily Mail Online
text: 7 wins, 4 draws, 0 defeats League games without him: 6 wins, 5 draws, 5 defeats And Scholes believes United would be making a mistake if they did not try to extend his stay. 'He's definitely worth another year,' Scholes told Goal . 'He's always in the right place, he plays his position brilliantly and when he came into the team from October onwards there were something like 16, 17 or 18 games maybe where they didn't lose. Paul Scholes believes Michael Carrick has helped United get the best out of Paul Pogba 'He had a big influence on people like Paul Pogba, he got the best out of him and [Ander] Herrera. He's just tailed off a little bit over the last couple of weeks but I still think he's got a part to play.' Manchester United head into this weekend's EFL Cup final with Southampton on the back of only one defeat in their last 24 matches. Carrick has started 16 of those matches, winning 11. Paul Scholes said he 'always felt comfortable' playing alongside Michael Carrick at United And Scholes said he knows from his own experiences playing for United, just how much influence of a 'big help' Carrick is to their team. 'If you wandered off somewhere it didn't matter because Michael would be there behind you backing you up,' Scholes said. 'It was just about being really comfortable with who's playing next to you and whenever I played with Michael I always felt comfortable.' RELATED ARTICLES
